title: Star Trek: Picard Almost Brought Back a Different Classic Villain
description:

But it’s quickly proven itself to be nostalgic for more than just TNG when it comes to Star Trek’s past... including with its major villain, who was almost replaced by another familiar…

title: After Three Long Years, La Niña Is Out
description:
After a particularly extended stay, the La Niña weather phenomenon that’s persisted for the past three years, contributing to extreme weather worldwide, has finally come to an end.

title: After Surviving a Trip to the Moon, Manikins Helga and Zohar Are Back Home for Analysis
description:
NASA’s Artemis 1 mission may not have had real astronauts on board the Orion capsule, but there was an inanimate crew that went on the lunar trip. Two of the manikins that took part in the inaugural mission have been returned to their home in Germany, where the data they collected will be used to design ways to…

title: HBO Max Is Reportedly Changing Its Name—Again
description:
Warner Bros. Discovery is reportedly dropping HBO from the name of its HBO Max streaming service as execs speculate that the branding is responsible for lackluster subscriptions. The possibility of a name change comes as HBO Max is merging with Discovery+ this spring.

title: Marco Rubio Reminds You to Adjust Your Clock on Sunday With Renewed Push for Permanent Daylight Saving Time
description:

description:

title: What Is an Xvid File and How Do I Play or Convert One?
description:

It’s essentially a way of compressing video, and it’s been around since 2001—and here we’re going to explain…

description:

You can also use your own pins for your own purposes, and you’ve got a few options when it comes to dropping pins in Google Maps in both the mobile and desktop interfaces.

description:

description:

title: For Every Person on Earth, There Are 21,000 Pieces of Plastic in the Ocean
description:
An analysis of global plastic data over the past four decades, published in the journal PLOS ONE, found that there’s now an estimated 170 trillion plastic particles—more than 2.2 million tons—floating in the world’s oceans. That number saw a sharp increase in the past 15 years, dovetailing, the researchers found, with…

title: 19 States That Have Passed Permanent Daylight Savings Time and Why They Haven’t Implemented It
description:
Come Sunday, March 12, at 2:00 a.m. EST, Daylight Saving Time will begin. We’ll lose an hour because the 20th-century federal government decided we should. Then on November 5th we’ll gain an hour, and be plunged into darkness. For over half a century, we’ve accepted that this cycle is normal.

description:
